resources.string: Native Species - White fur on the abdomen, gray fur on sides and back, tail very bushy with white-tipped hairs.
Native Species - Fur on abdomen is light to dark orange, grayish-brown fur on sides and back, found in coniferous (pine) forests.
Introduced Species - White fur on the abdomen, light gray to rust colored fur on the sides and back, tail is light gray with rust coloration and hairs have white tips.
Introduced Species - Orange to rust colored fur on abdomen, reddish-brown colored fur on sides, back, and tail.
Introduced Species - Black fur all over the animal. The melanistic color variant is present in populations of both the Eastern Gray Squirrel and the Eastern Fox Squirrel.
